meanings.definition: A person who tells anecdotes or stories.
meanings.sent1: The raconteurs at the party had everyone laughing with their funny tales.
meanings.sent2: The elderly man was known in the village as the best raconteur, captivating listeners with his stories.
meanings.sent3: The raconteurs at the library event had the audience in stitches with their hilarious anecdotes.
meanings.sent4: Her grandfather was a true raconteur, weaving magical stories that transported listeners to different worlds.
meanings.sent5: The children gathered around the campfire, wide-eyed as the raconteur spun a spooky ghost story.

meanings.definition: A group of people who are skilled at storytelling.
meanings.sent1: The raconteurs in the theater troupe brought the play to life with their engaging narratives.
meanings.sent2: The annual storytelling festival attracted raconteurs from far and wide to share their talents.
meanings.sent3: The raconteurs at the family reunion had a friendly competition to see who could tell the most captivating story.
meanings.sent4: The team of raconteurs worked together to create a mesmerizing tale that left the audience spellbound.
meanings.sent5: The group of raconteurs gathered around the campfire, each taking turns to spin a yarn under the starlit sky.
